sources.title: Reed Paradise
sources.description:
The end of the 80s, perestroika. A young intelligent Kesha gets into a society of vagabonds, from whom someone forms a brigade "for earnings". The brigade ends up in a real concentration camp, having turned into a free workforce. A small camp world, divided into the masters of life and disenfranchised vagabonds - this is a model of our huge cruel world, in which in fact there is nothing more precious than the human soul.

Year of production: 1989

Director: Tsyplakova Elena
Writers: Ageev Igor, Beloshnikov Sergey
Composer: Petrovsky Vladislav
Operator: Karavaev Elizbar
Production designer: Murzin Vladimir

Actors: Alexander Trofimov, Nikolai Stotsky, Alexander Bureev, Valery Kravchenko, Vladimir Zubenko, Joseph Ryklin, Ivan Arakelov, Vladimir Vinogradov, Vladimir Gubanov (Tyukin), Leonid Gromov, Victor Pomortsev, Rafik Sabirov, Valery Afanasyev, Victor Goncharov, Evgeny Degtyarenko, Zhalas Iskakov, Alfred Kamelevsky, Vladimir Knyazev, Anatoly Salnikov, Valery Smolyakov, Igor Shapovalov
